discourse_list.title: Know Your MIP KYM #12 | Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments

content.content: Know Your MIP KYM #12 | Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments The Know Your MIP series resurgence continues! For this series’ 12th session, we will host Recognized Delegate Tim Black @twblack88 to explore MIP4c-2-SP15. This amendment addresses the gaps in the Core Unit Offboarding process for the Core Unit MIP set. Work on this amendment is near completion, but the final details could use additional input.  Join us! @Retro will host   Agenda:  A review of the amendment’s changelog (there might be memes) Discussion on the final component in progress; the interim facilitator process   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-06-14T17:00:00Z  Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where CrowdCast Call   crowdcast    Know Your MIP #12 | Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments Register now for Know Your MIP #12 | Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments on crowdcast, scheduled to go live on June 14, 2022, 12:00 PM CDT.      att: @Core-Facilitators, @Recognized-Delegates, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit
Do we have the recording for this? Thank you
Just added  Know Your MIP KYM #12 | Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments - YouTube

Know Your MIP #12 - Summary June 14th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Retro  00:46: Presentation, Discussion and Questions with Tim Black  40:04: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/13g3-Rz-ncc  Introduction  Retro  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello to everyone. Thank you for joining session #12 of Know Your MIP. Today we have a special guest, a recognized delegate, Tim Black. He will be discussing the Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments that he has been working on collaboratively with many members across the DAO. Please feel free to ask any questions that you have throughout the presentation. We will happily take breaks in the action to have them addressed in real-time. For other episodes of KYM, please check the forum.   Presentation  Tim Black 00:46  Know Your MIP/ MIP 4c2SP151629×928 101 KB   TL;DR'Thankless Clarity'1632×930 84.7 KB   Changelog1627×934 164 KB   MIP 38 (Primitives?)1628×931 124 KB   MIP391630×933 199 KB   CU MIP Bundle1629×932 147 KB   1627×930 138 KB   MIP39c3 Template1629×932 239 KB   MIP411628×931 222 KB   I thought there was process?1630×932 131 KB   It's solution time1628×935 80 KB   Explore these questions & define next steps1628×935 162 KB   Questions 20:35 - David Utrobin: What are the recommended numbers for compensation? 21:52 - Retro: What is the quickest process to pick an interim facilitator? Have you put any thought into if the interim facilitator that is picked is not supported by the contributors in the CU? And has there been any alternative work where the facilitator is not necessarily the one that needs to be replaced; it is more the team that supports it. 23:42 - David Utrobin: Why would it not be someone from inside the team that would be nominated? 23:51 - Retro: Can anyone nominate someone for the role? 26:53 - Retro: It might be good to jump back to the flow chart and walk through that in more detail to generate some questions. 28:54 - Retro: What time frame are we talking about for the interim facilitator to have their vote? 30:00 -Joshua: What were the cases for facilitators we want to avoid again? 32:00 - Retro: Are there other ways to increase compensation? 32:38 - Payton Rose: What aspect of the revisions are you most worried about/seeking more critical eyes? Is there anything supporting parties can do to help push this proposal forward? 33:38 - Retro: What were your thoughts on a zoom poll or the forums, do you want it transparent to show who is supporting it or keep it a little bit more obscured? 36:01 - Retro: Would an offboarding pursue a different path than an unplanned interim facilitator? 38:36 - Retro: Can you comment on some of the next evolution you may be seeing or thoughts about that future state?  Closing Comment  Retro  Outro 40:04  I appreciate this call today. The effort that is gone into this and the improvements are very evident, but to talk through those changes and appreciate the amount of thought that has gone into it is definitely something that I hope continues improving existing MIPs and drafting some more impactful MIPs for the future here at MakerDAO. We will wrap up. The conversation is still ongoing on the forums, and there are opportunities to contribute. Pick up the conversation at forum.makerdao.com. We will see everybody at the next session.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
